element.Description: The record is active in the system
element.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
element.Name: Active

window.Help: The Business Partner window allows you do define any party with whom you transact. This includes customers, vendors and employees. Prior to entering or importing products, you must define your vendors. Prior to generating Orders you must define your customers. This window holds all information about your business partner and the values entered will be used to generate all document transactions

element.Help: A search key allows you a fast method of finding a particular record. If you leave the search key empty, the system automatically creates a numeric number. column.Help: You need to define a Print Format to print the document.
column.Name: Invoice Print Format

element.Help: Credit Management is inactive if Credit Status is No Credit Check, Credit Stop or if the Credit Limit is 0. If active, the status is set automatically set to Credit Hold, if the Total Open Balance (including Vendor activities) is higher then the Credit Limit. It is set to Credit Watch, if above 90% of the Credit Limit and Credit OK otherwise.
element.Name: Credit Status

column.Help: Credit Management is inactive if Credit Status is No Credit Check, Credit Stop or if the Credit Limit is 0. If active, the status is set automatically set to Credit Hold, if the Total Open Balance (including Vendor activities) is higher then the Credit Limit. It is set to Credit Watch, if above 90% of the Credit Limit and Credit OK otherwise.
column.Name: Credit Status

element.Description: Minimum Shelf Life in percent based on Product Instance Guarantee Date
element.Help: Minimum Shelf Life of products with Guarantee Date instance. If > 0 you cannot select products with a shelf life ((Guarantee Date-Today) / Guarantee Days) less than the minimum shelf life, unless you select "Show All"
element.Name: Min Shelf Life %

column.Description: Minimum Shelf Life in percent based on Product Instance Guarantee Date
column.Help: Minimum Shelf Life of products with Guarantee Date instance. If > 0 you cannot select products with a shelf life ((Guarantee Date-Today) / Guarantee Days) less than the minimum shelf life, unless you select "Show All"
column.Name: Min Shelf Life %

element.Description: The Business Partner is another Organization for explicit Inter-Org transactions
element.Help: The business partner is another organization in the system. So when performing transactions, the counter-document is created automatically. Example: You have BPartnerA linked to OrgA and BPartnerB linked to OrgB. If you create a sales order for BPartnerB in OrgA a purchase order is created for BPartnerA in OrgB. This allows to have explicit documents for Inter-Org transactions.
element.Name: Linked Organization

process.Name: Link Organization
process.Description: Link Business Partner to an Organization
process.Help: If the Business Partner is another Organization, select the Organization or set to empty to create a new Organization. You link a Business Partner to an Organization to create explicit Documents for Inter-Org transaction. If you create a new Organization, you may supply a Organization Type. If you select a Role, the access to the new Organization is limited to that role, otherwise all (non manual) roles of the Client will have access to the new Organization.

dynvalrule.Name: AD_Org Not Linked
dynvalrule.Code: AD_Org.AD_Org_ID <> 0 AND AD_Org.IsSummary='N' AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM C_BPartner bp WHERE AD_Org.AD_Org_ID=bp.AD_OrgBP_ID)
dynvalrule.Description: Not Summary - Not 0 - Not linked to BP

processpara.Name: Existing Organization
processpara.Description: Organizational entity within client - set to empty if you want to create a new organization
processpara.Help: An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.

processpara.Name: Organization Type
processpara.Help: Organization Type allows you to categorize your organizations for reporting purposes

processpara.Name: Limit Access to Role
processpara.Description: If no Role is selected, grant access to all (non-manual) roles of the Client
processpara.Help: The Role determines security and access a user who has this Role will have in the System.

column.Description: The Business Partner is another Organization for explicit Inter-Org transactions
column.Help: The business partner is another organization in the system. So when performing transactions, the counter-document is created automatically. Example: You have BPartnerA linked to OrgA and BPartnerB linked to OrgB. If you create a sales order for BPartnerB in OrgA a purchase order is created for BPartnerA in OrgB. This allows to have explicit documents for Inter-Org transactions.
column.Name: Linked Organization

element.Description: Total Open Balance Amount in primary Accounting Currency
element.Help: The Total Open Balance Amount is the calculated open item amount for Customer and Vendor activity. If the Balance is below zero, we owe the Business Partner. The amount is used for Credit Management. Invoices and Payment Allocations determine the Open Balance (i.e. not Orders or Payments).
element.Name: Open Balance

column.Description: Total Open Balance Amount in primary Accounting Currency
column.Help: The Total Open Balance Amount is the calculated open item amount for Customer and Vendor activity. If the Balance is below zero, we owe the Business Partner. The amount is used for Credit Management. Invoices and Payment Allocations determine the Open Balance (i.e. not Orders or Payments).
column.Name: Open Balance

element.Description: Business partner is exempt from tax on purchases
element.Help: If a business partner is exempt from tax on purchases, the exempt tax rate is used. For this, you need to set up a tax rate with a 0% rate and indicate that this is your tax exempt rate. This is required for tax reporting, so that you can track tax exempt transactions.
element.Name: PO Tax exempt

column.Description: Business partner is exempt from tax on purchases

column.Name: PO Tax exempt

element.Description: Indicate role of this Business partner as Manufacturer

tab.Name: Business Partner
tab.Help: The Business Partner Tab defines any Entity with whom an organization transacts.

field.Name: Business Partner
field.Help: A Business Partner is anyone with whom you transact. This can include Vendor, Customer, Employee or Salesperson

field.Name: Credit Used
field.Help: The Credit Used indicates the total amount of open or unpaid invoices in primary accounting currency for the Business Partner. Credit Management is based on the Total Open Amount, which includes Vendor activities.

field.Name: Invoice Rule
field.Help: The Invoice Rule defines how a Business Partner is invoiced and the frequency of invoicing.

field.Name: Payment Term
field.Help: Payment Terms identify the method and timing of payment.

field.Name: Invoice Schedule
field.Help: The Invoice Schedule identifies the frequency used when generating invoices.

field.Name: PO Payment Term
field.Description: Payment rules for a purchase order
field.Help: The PO Payment Term indicates the payment term that will be used when this purchase order becomes an invoice.

field.Name: Order Description
field.Description: Description to be used on orders
field.Help: The Order Description identifies the standard description to use on orders for this Customer.

field.Name: Freight Cost Rule
field.Help: The Freight Cost Rule indicates the method used when charging for freight.

field.Name: Credit Limit
field.Help: The Credit Limit indicates the total amount allowed "on account" in primary accounting currency. If the Credit Limit is 0, no check is performed. Credit Management is based on the Total Open Amount, which includes Vendor activities.

field.Name: Delivery Via
field.Description: How the order will be delivered
field.Help: The Delivery Via indicates how the products should be delivered. For example, will the order be picked up or shipped.

field.Name: PO Discount Schema
field.Description: Schema to calculate the purchase trade discount percentage

field.Name: Order Reference
field.Description: Transaction Reference Number (Sales Order, Purchase Order) of your Business Partner
field.Help: The business partner order reference is the order reference for this specific transaction; Often Purchase Order numbers are given to print on Invoices for easier reference. A standard number can be defined in the Business Partner (Customer) window.

field.Name: Payment Rule
field.Help: The Payment Rule indicates the method of purchase payment.

field.Name: Discount Schema
field.Description: Schema to calculate the trade discount percentage
field.Help: After calculation of the (standard) price, the trade discount percentage is calculated and applied resulting in the final price.

field.Name: Delivery Rule
field.Help: The Delivery Rule indicates when an order should be delivered. For example should the order be delivered when the entire order is complete, when a line is complete or as the products become available.

field.Name: Discount Printed
field.Description: Print Discount on Invoice and Order
field.Help: The Discount Printed Checkbox indicates if the discount will be printed on the document.

field.Name: Customer
field.Description: Indicates if this Business Partner is a Customer
field.Help: The Customer checkbox indicates if this Business Partner is a customer. If it is select additional fields will display which further define this customer.

field.Name: Sales Representative
field.Help: The Sales Representative indicates the Sales Rep for this Region. Any Sales Rep must be a valid internal user.

field.Name: Send EMail
field.Help: Send emails with document attached (e.g. Invoice, Delivery Note, etc.)

field.Name: Partner Parent
field.Help: The parent (organization) of the Business Partner for reporting purposes.

field.Name: Invoice Print Format
field.Help: You need to define a Print Format to print the document.

field.Name: Min Shelf Life %
field.Description: Minimum Shelf Life in percent based on Product Instance Guarantee Date
field.Help: Minimum Shelf Life of products with Guarantee Date instance. If > 0 you cannot select products with a shelf life ((Guarantee Date-Today) / Guarantee Days) less than the minimum shelf life, unless you select "Show All"

field.Name: Purchase Pricelist
field.Description: Price List used by this Business Partner
field.Help: Identifies the price list used by a Vendor for products purchased by this organization.

field.Name: Price List
field.Description: Unique identifier of a Price List
field.Help: Price Lists are used to determine the pricing, margin and cost of items purchased or sold.

field.Name: Vendor
field.Description: Indicates if this Business Partner is a Vendor
field.Help: The Vendor checkbox indicates if this Business Partner is a Vendor. If it is selected, additional fields will display which further identify this vendor.

field.Name: Payment Rule
field.Help: The Payment Rule indicates the method of invoice payment.

field.Name: Document Copies
field.Description: Number of copies to be printed
field.Help: The Document Copies indicates the number of copies of each document that will be generated.

field.Name: Sales Representative
field.Description: Indicates if the business partner is a sales representative or company agent
field.Help: The Sales Rep checkbox indicates if this business partner is a sales representative. A sales representative may also be an employee, but does not need to be.

field.Name: Dunning
field.Help: The Dunning indicates the rules and method of dunning for past due payments.

field.Name: Client
field.Help: A Client is a company or a legal entity. You cannot share data between Clients. Tenant is a synonym for Client.

field.Name: Organization
field.Help: An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.

field.Name: SO Tax exempt
field.Description: Business partner is exempt from tax on sales
field.Help: If a business partner is exempt from tax on sales, the exempt tax rate is used. For this, you need to set up a tax rate with a 0% rate and indicate that this is your tax exempt rate. This is required for tax reporting, so that you can track tax exempt transactions.

field.Name: Tax ID
field.Help: The Tax ID field identifies the legal Identification number of this Entity.

field.Name: Search Key
field.Description: Search key for the record in the format required - must be unique
field.Help: A search key allows you a fast method of finding a particular record. If you leave the search key empty, the system automatically creates a numeric number. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

field.Name: Employee
field.Description: Indicates if this Business Partner is an employee
field.Help: The Employee checkbox indicates if this Business Partner is an Employee. If it is selected, additional fields will display which further identify this employee.

field.Name: Greeting
field.Help: The Greeting identifies the greeting to print on correspondence.

field.Name: Name
field.Help: The name of an entity (record) is used as an default search option in addition to the search key. The name is up to 60 characters in length.

field.Name: Description
field.Description: Optional short description of the record
field.Help: A description is limited to 255 characters.

field.Name: Active
field.Description: The record is active in the system
field.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

field.Name: Summary Level
field.Help: A summary entity represents a branch in a tree rather than an end-node. Summary entities are used for reporting and do not have own values.

field.Name: Credit Status
field.Help: Credit Management is inactive if Credit Status is No Credit Check, Credit Stop or if the Credit Limit is 0. If active, the status is set automatically set to Credit Hold, if the Total Open Balance (including Vendor activities) is higher then the Credit Limit. It is set to Credit Watch, if above 90% of the Credit Limit and Credit OK otherwise.

field.Name: Open Balance
field.Description: Total Open Balance Amount in primary Accounting Currency
field.Help: The Total Open Balance Amount is the calculated open item amount for Customer and Vendor activity. If the Balance is below zero, we owe the Business Partner. The amount is used for Credit Management. Invoices and Payment Allocations determine the Open Balance (i.e. not Orders or Payments).

field.Name: PO Tax exempt
field.Description: Business partner is exempt from tax on purchases
field.Help: If a business partner is exempt from tax on purchases, the exempt tax rate is used. For this, you need to set up a tax rate with a 0% rate and indicate that this is your tax exempt rate. This is required for tax reporting, so that you can track tax exempt transactions.

field.Name: Reference No
field.Description: Your customer or vendor number at the Business Partner's site
field.Help: The reference number can be printed on orders and invoices to allow your business partner to faster identify your records.

field.Name: NAICS/SIC
field.Description: Standard Industry Code or its successor NAIC - http://www.osha.gov/oshstats/sicser.html
field.Help: The NAICS/SIC identifies either of these codes that may be applicable to this Business Partner.

field.Name: D-U-N-S
field.Help: Used for EDI - For details see www.dnb.com/dunsno/list.htm

field.Name: Rating
field.Help: The Rating is used to differentiate the importance

field.Name: Business Partner Group
field.Help: The Business Partner Group provides a method of defining defaults to be used for individual Business Partners.

field.Name: Language
field.Description: Language for this Business Partner if Multi-Language enabled
field.Help: The Language identifies the language to use for display and formatting documents. It requires, that on Client level, Multi-Lingual documents are selected and that you have created/loaded the language.

field.Name: URL
field.Help: The URL defines an fully qualified web address like http://www.adempiere.org

field.Name: Prospect
field.Help: The Prospect checkbox indicates an entity that is an active prospect.

field.Name: Link Organization
field.Description: Link Business Partner to an Organization
field.Help: If the Business Partner is another Organization, select the Organization or set to empty to create a new Organization. You link a Business Partner to an Organization to create explicit Documents for Inter-Org transaction. If you create a new Organization, you may supply a Organization Type. If you select a Role, the access to the new Organization is limited to that role, otherwise all (non manual) roles of the Client will have access to the new Organization.

field.Name: Potential Life Time Value
field.Help: The Potential Life Time Value is the anticipated revenue in primary accounting currency to be generated by the Business Partner.

field.Name: Actual Life Time Value
field.Help: The Actual Life Time Value is the recorded revenue in primary accounting currency generated by the Business Partner.

field.Name: Acquisition Cost
field.Description: The cost of gaining the prospect as a customer
field.Help: The Acquisition Cost identifies the cost associated with making this prospect a customer.

field.Name: Employees
field.Help: Indicates the number of employees for this Business Partner. This field displays only for Prospects.

field.Name: Share
field.Description: Share of Customer's business as a percentage
field.Help: The Share indicates the percentage of this Business Partner's volume of the products supplied.

field.Name: Sales Volume in 1.000
field.Description: Total Volume of Sales in Thousands of Currency
field.Help: The Sales Volume indicates the total volume of sales for a Business Partner.

field.Name: First Sale
field.Help: The First Sale Date identifies the date of the first sale to this Business Partner

field.Name: Is Manufacturer
field.Description: Indicate role of this Business partner as Manufacturer

field.Name: Active
field.Description: The record is active in the system
field.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

field.Name: Customer Receivables
field.Help: The Customer Receivables Accounts indicates the account to be used for recording transaction for customers receivables.

field.Name: Receivable Services
field.Help: Account to post services related Accounts Receivables if you want to differentiate between Services and Product related revenue. This account is only used, if posting to service accounts is enabled in the accounting schema.

field.Name: Customer Prepayment
field.Help: The Customer Prepayment account indicates the account to be used for recording prepayments from a customer.

tab.Name: Vendor
tab.Help: The Vendor Tab defines a Business Partner that is a Vendor for this Organization. If the Vendor check box is selected the necessary fields will display.

field.Name: Business Partner
field.Help: A Business Partner is anyone with whom you transact. This can include Vendor, Customer, Employee or Salesperson

field.Name: Invoice Rule
field.Help: The Invoice Rule defines how a Business Partner is invoiced and the frequency of invoicing.

field.Name: Payment Term
field.Help: Payment Terms identify the method and timing of payment.

field.Name: Tax ID
field.Help: The Tax ID field identifies the legal Identification number of this Entity.

field.Name: Invoice Schedule
field.Help: The Invoice Schedule identifies the frequency used when generating invoices.

field.Name: Business Partner Group
field.Help: The Business Partner Group provides a method of defining defaults to be used for individual Business Partners.

field.Name: Order Description
field.Description: Description to be used on orders
field.Help: The Order Description identifies the standard description to use on orders for this Customer.

field.Name: Freight Cost Rule
field.Help: The Freight Cost Rule indicates the method used when charging for freight.

field.Name: Credit Limit
field.Help: The Credit Limit indicates the total amount allowed "on account" in primary accounting currency. If the Credit Limit is 0, no check is performed. Credit Management is based on the Total Open Amount, which includes Vendor activities.

field.Name: Delivery Via
field.Description: How the order will be delivered
field.Help: The Delivery Via indicates how the products should be delivered. For example, will the order be picked up or shipped.

field.Name: Order Reference
field.Description: Transaction Reference Number (Sales Order, Purchase Order) of your Business Partner
field.Help: The business partner order reference is the order reference for this specific transaction; Often Purchase Order numbers are given to print on Invoices for easier reference. A standard number can be defined in the Business Partner (Customer) window.

field.Name: First Sale
field.Help: The First Sale Date identifies the date of the first sale to this Business Partner

field.Name: Prospect
field.Help: The Prospect checkbox indicates an entity that is an active prospect.

field.Name: Discount Schema
field.Description: Schema to calculate the trade discount percentage
field.Help: After calculation of the (standard) price, the trade discount percentage is calculated and applied resulting in the final price.

field.Name: Delivery Rule
field.Help: The Delivery Rule indicates when an order should be delivered. For example should the order be delivered when the entire order is complete, when a line is complete or as the products become available.

field.Name: Discount Printed
field.Description: Print Discount on Invoice and Order
field.Help: The Discount Printed Checkbox indicates if the discount will be printed on the document.

field.Name: Customer
field.Description: Indicates if this Business Partner is a Customer
field.Help: The Customer checkbox indicates if this Business Partner is a customer. If it is select additional fields will display which further define this customer.

field.Name: Sales Representative
field.Help: The Sales Representative indicates the Sales Rep for this Region. Any Sales Rep must be a valid internal user.

field.Name: Greeting
field.Help: The Greeting identifies the greeting to print on correspondence.

field.Name: Send EMail
field.Help: Send emails with document attached (e.g. Invoice, Delivery Note, etc.)

field.Name: Partner Parent
field.Help: The parent (organization) of the Business Partner for reporting purposes.

field.Name: Invoice Print Format
field.Help: You need to define a Print Format to print the document.

field.Name: Credit Status
field.Help: Credit Management is inactive if Credit Status is No Credit Check, Credit Stop or if the Credit Limit is 0. If active, the status is set automatically set to Credit Hold, if the Total Open Balance (including Vendor activities) is higher then the Credit Limit. It is set to Credit Watch, if above 90% of the Credit Limit and Credit OK otherwise.

field.Name: Min Shelf Life %
field.Description: Minimum Shelf Life in percent based on Product Instance Guarantee Date
field.Help: Minimum Shelf Life of products with Guarantee Date instance. If > 0 you cannot select products with a shelf life ((Guarantee Date-Today) / Guarantee Days) less than the minimum shelf life, unless you select "Show All"

field.Name: Link Organization
field.Description: Link Business Partner to an Organization
field.Help: If the Business Partner is another Organization, select the Organization or set to empty to create a new Organization. You link a Business Partner to an Organization to create explicit Documents for Inter-Org transaction. If you create a new Organization, you may supply a Organization Type. If you select a Role, the access to the new Organization is limited to that role, otherwise all (non manual) roles of the Client will have access to the new Organization.

field.Name: D-U-N-S
field.Help: Used for EDI - For details see www.dnb.com/dunsno/list.htm

field.Name: Sales Volume in 1.000
field.Description: Total Volume of Sales in Thousands of Currency
field.Help: The Sales Volume indicates the total volume of sales for a Business Partner.

field.Name: Credit Used
field.Help: The Credit Used indicates the total amount of open or unpaid invoices in primary accounting currency for the Business Partner. Credit Management is based on the Total Open Amount, which includes Vendor activities.

field.Name: Reference No
field.Description: Your customer or vendor number at the Business Partner's site
field.Help: The reference number can be printed on orders and invoices to allow your business partner to faster identify your records.

field.Name: Acquisition Cost
field.Description: The cost of gaining the prospect as a customer
field.Help: The Acquisition Cost identifies the cost associated with making this prospect a customer.

field.Name: Rating
field.Help: The Rating is used to differentiate the importance

field.Name: URL
field.Help: The URL defines an fully qualified web address like http://www.adempiere.org

field.Name: Price List
field.Description: Unique identifier of a Price List
field.Help: Price Lists are used to determine the pricing, margin and cost of items purchased or sold.

field.Name: Language
field.Help: The Language identifies the language to use for display and formatting

field.Name: Actual Life Time Value
field.Help: The Actual Life Time Value is the recorded revenue in primary accounting currency generated by the Business Partner.

field.Name: Share
field.Description: Share of Customer's business as a percentage
field.Help: The Share indicates the percentage of this Business Partner's volume of the products supplied.

field.Name: Payment Rule
field.Help: The Payment Rule indicates the method of invoice payment.

field.Name: Potential Life Time Value
field.Help: The Potential Life Time Value is the anticipated revenue in primary accounting currency to be generated by the Business Partner.

field.Name: Document Copies
field.Description: Number of copies to be printed
field.Help: The Document Copies indicates the number of copies of each document that will be generated.

field.Name: Summary Level
field.Help: A summary entity represents a branch in a tree rather than an end-node. Summary entities are used for reporting and do not have own values.

field.Name: SO Tax exempt
field.Description: Business partner is exempt from tax on sales
field.Help: If a business partner is exempt from tax on sales, the exempt tax rate is used. For this, you need to set up a tax rate with a 0% rate and indicate that this is your tax exempt rate. This is required for tax reporting, so that you can track tax exempt transactions.

field.Name: Employee
field.Description: Indicates if this Business Partner is an employee
field.Help: The Employee checkbox indicates if this Business Partner is an Employee. If it is selected, additional fields will display which further identify this employee.

field.Name: Dunning
field.Help: The Dunning indicates the rules and method of dunning for past due payments.

field.Name: NAICS/SIC
field.Description: Standard Industry Code or its successor NAIC - http://www.osha.gov/oshstats/sicser.html
field.Help: The NAICS/SIC identifies either of these codes that may be applicable to this Business Partner.

field.Name: Description
field.Description: Optional short description of the record
field.Help: A description is limited to 255 characters.

field.Name: Employees
field.Help: Indicates the number of employees for this Business Partner. This field displays only for Prospects.

field.Name: Open Balance
field.Description: Total Open Balance Amount in primary Accounting Currency
field.Help: The Total Open Balance Amount is the calculated open item amount for Customer and Vendor activity. If the Balance is below zero, we owe the Business Partner. The amount is used for Credit Management. Invoices and Payment Allocations determine the Open Balance (i.e. not Orders or Payments).

field.Name: Client
field.Help: A Client is a company or a legal entity. You cannot share data between Clients. Tenant is a synonym for Client.

field.Name: Organization
field.Help: An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.

field.Name: Search Key
field.Description: Search key for the record in the format required - must be unique
field.Help: A search key allows you a fast method of finding a particular record. If you leave the search key empty, the system automatically creates a numeric number. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

field.Name: Name
field.Help: The name of an entity (record) is used as an default search option in addition to the search key. The name is up to 60 characters in length.

field.Name: Active
field.Description: The record is active in the system
field.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

field.Name: Vendor
field.Description: Indicates if this Business Partner is a Vendor
field.Help: The Vendor checkbox indicates if this Business Partner is a Vendor. If it is selected, additional fields will display which further identify this vendor.

field.Name: Sales Representative
field.Description: Indicates if the business partner is a sales representative or company agent
field.Help: The Sales Rep checkbox indicates if this business partner is a sales representative. A sales representative may also be an employee, but does not need to be.

field.Name: Payment Rule
field.Help: The Payment Rule indicates the method of purchase payment.

field.Name: PO Payment Term
field.Description: Payment rules for a purchase order
field.Help: The PO Payment Term indicates the payment term that will be used when this purchase order becomes an invoice.

field.Name: Purchase Pricelist
field.Description: Price List used by this Business Partner
field.Help: Identifies the price list used by a Vendor for products purchased by this organization.

field.Name: PO Discount Schema
field.Description: Schema to calculate the purchase trade discount percentage

field.Name: Is Manufacturer
field.Description: Indicate role of this Business partner as Manufacturer

There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. element.Description: User Name used for authorization via LDAP (directory) services
element.Help: Optional LDAP system user name for the user. If not defined, the normal Name of the user is used. This allows to use the internal (LDAP) user id (e.g. jjanke) and the normal display name (e.g. Jorg Janke). The LDAP User Name can also be used without LDAP enables (see system window). This would allow to sign in as jjanke and use the display name of Jorg Janke.

element.Description: How a Java Client connects to the server(s)
element.Help: Depending on the connection profile, different protocols are used and tasks are performed on the server rather then the client. Usually the user can select different profiles, unless it is enforced by the User or Role definition. The User level profile overwrites the Role based profile.
element.Name: Connection Profile

column.Description: How a Java Client connects to the server(s)

Usually the user can select different profiles, unless it is enforced by the User or Role definition. The User level profile overwrites the Role based profile.
column.Name: Connection Profile

column.Description: Search key for the record in the format required - must be unique
column.Help: A search key allows you a fast method of finding a particular record. If you leave the search key empty, the system automatically creates a numeric number. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
column.Name: Search Key

field.Help: A Client is a company or a legal entity. You cannot share data between Clients. Tenant is a synonym for Client.

field.Name: Organization
field.Help: An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.

field.Name: Business Partner
field.Help: A Business Partner is anyone with whom you transact. This can include Vendor, Customer, Employee or Salesperson

field.Name: Name
field.Help: The name of an entity (record) is used as an default search option in addition to the search key. The name is up to 60 characters in length.

field.Name: Description
field.Description: Optional short description of the record
field.Help: A description is limited to 255 characters.

field.Name: Comments
field.Help: The Comments field allows for free form entry of additional information.

field.Name: Active
field.Description: The record is active in the system
field.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

field.Name: EMail Address
field.Help: The Email Address is the Electronic Mail ID for this User and should be fully qualified (e.g. joe.smith@company.com). The Email Address is used to access the self service application functionality from the web.

field.Name: Password
field.Help: The Password for this User. Passwords are required to identify authorized users. For Adempiere Users, you can change the password via the Process "Reset Password".

field.Name: Greeting
field.Help: The Greeting identifies the greeting to print on correspondence.

field.Name: Partner Location
field.Description: Identifies the (ship to) address for this Business Partner
field.Help: The Partner address indicates the location of a Business Partner

field.Name: Title
field.Description: Name this entity is referred to as
field.Help: The Title indicates the name that an entity is referred to as.

field.Name: Birthday
field.Help: Birthday or Anniversary day

field.Name: Phone
field.Help: The Phone field identifies a telephone number

field.Name: 2nd Phone
field.Help: The 2nd Phone field identifies an alternate telephone number.

field.Name: Fax
field.Help: The Fax identifies a facsimile number for this Business Partner or Location

field.Name: Notification Type
field.Help: Emails or Notification sent out for Request Updates, etc.

field.Name: Full BP Access
field.Description: The user/contact has full access to Business Partner information and resources
field.Help: If selected, the user has full access to the Business Partner (BP) information (Business Documents like Orders, Invoices - Requests) or resources (Assets, Downloads). If you deselect it, the user has no access rights unless, you explicitly grant it in tab "BP Access"

field.Name: Verification Info
field.Help: The field contains additional information how the EMail Address has been verified

field.Name: Last Contact
field.Description: Date this individual was last contacted
field.Help: The Last Contact indicates the date that this Business Partner Contact was last contacted.

field.Name: Last Result
field.Help: The Last Result identifies the result of the last contact made.

element.Help:
The SO Sub Type indicates the type of sales order this document refers to. This field only appears when the Document Base Type is Sales Order. The selection made here will determine which documents will be generated when an order is processed and which documents must be generated manually or in batches.
The following outlines this process.
SO Sub Type of Standard Order will generate just the Order document when the order is processed.
The Delivery Note, Invoice and Receipt must be generated via other processes.
SO Sub Type of Warehouse Order will generate the Order and Delivery Note.
The Invoice and Receipt must be generated via other processes.
SO Sub Type of Credit Order will generate the Order, Delivery Note and Invoice.
The Receipt must be generated via other processes.
SO Sub Type of POS (Point of Sale) will generate all document
element.Name: SO Sub Type

column.Help:

SO Sub Type of Standard Order will generate just the Order document when the order is processed.
The Delivery Note, Invoice and Receipt must be generated via other processes.
SO Sub Type of Warehouse Order will generate the Order and Delivery Note.
The Invoice and Receipt must be generated via other processes.
SO Sub Type of Credit Order will generate the Order, Delivery Note and Invoice.
The Receipt must be generated via other processes.
SO Sub Type of POS (Point of Sale) will generate all document
column.Name: SO Sub Type

field.Help: If the confirmation contains differences, the original document is split allowing the original document (shipment) to be processed and updating Inventory - and the newly created document for handling the dispute at a later time. Until the confirmation is processed, the inventory is not updated.

field.Name: In Transit
field.Help: Material Movement is in transit - shipped, but not received. The transaction is completed, if confirmed.

field.Name: Create Counter Document
field.Help: If selected, create specified counter document. If not selected, no counter document is created for the document type.

field.Name: Default Counter Document
field.Description: The document type is the default counter document type
field.Help: When using explicit documents for inter-org transaction (after linking a Business Partner to an Organization), you can determine what document type the counter document is based on the document type of the original transaction. Example: when generating a Sales Order, use this Sales Order document type. This default can be overwritten by defining explicit counter document relationships.

field.Name: Print Format
field.Help: The print format determines how data is rendered for print.

field.Name: Document Copies
field.Description: Number of copies to be printed
field.Help: The Document Copies indicates the number of copies of each document that will be generated.

field.Name: Indexed
field.Description: Index the document for the internal search engine
field.Help: For cross document search, the document can be indexed for faster search (Container, Document Type, Request Type)

column.Help: A Client is a company or a legal entity. You cannot share data between Clients. Tenant is a synonym for Client.
column.Name: Client

column.Help: An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.
column.Name: Organization

column.Description: The record is active in the system
column.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
column.Name: Active

E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
